result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amy Marie Schneller

defendant.name: Schneller, Amy Marie
defendant.address: 7345 South Lenox Avenue, Oak Creek, WI 53154

records.addlTxt: COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Sam Obscherning in court.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case calendared for a Status Conference. DEFENDANT FAILED TO APPEAR. Defense has no explanation for defendants non appearance.
Court ordered bench warrant issued, remand to the Commissioner, and no action on bail.

Attorney Sam Obscherning in court.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in Court for Deferred Prosecution Agreement Hearing. Defendant is not present. Defense advised the court that his client was unaware of this matter set, previous counsel is no long with the public defender's office.  Defense requested adjournment of proceedings. Court grants request and adjourns matter for a status conference Case remains calendared in Branch 30.  Status conference scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Matt W Kline in court.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for .  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Matter scheduled for Status Conference.  Defendant not in Court.  Court waives defendant's appearance.  Defense counsel requests DPA Hearing date.  Case adjourned, Br. 30.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Amy Marie Schneller in court with attorney Matt W Kline.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amy Marie Schneller appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Pretrial Conference held.  Defnese counsel advises Court of possible DPA resolution and requests status conference date.  Case adjourned, Br. 30.  Status conference scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Meijer - Oak Creek.

Defendant Amy Marie Schneller in court.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 30 for a Pretrial Conference.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/3/22 @ 2p
